title: Ornn - add shop shortcut to Forge Menu
body:
Wouldn't it be nice if Riot added a shop shortcut button to {{champion:516}} 's little Forge Menu in game? I was thinking instead of having 5 item suggestions in his Forge Menu, the left most button could be a icon that opens the shop, then have 4 item suggestions to the right of that. This would also make it so you don't have to pan away from where Ornn is on the map to open the shop. 

It took me a while to realize I could forge items besides the 5 suggested ones in his Forge Menu. A shop button would explain this to new Ornn players, AND be a convenience/help not having to pan away from where you are just to open the shop.

replies.body: You mean like 'P' which already opens the shop and then has all the forge items?
not everyone knows every single hotkey
I mean, it seems pretty standard to learn hotkeys in games you're playing

Not really, no. I know I do, because I'm sh*t with a mouse, I have coordination issues, but a lot of my friend do everything with the mouse and use their keyboard as little as possible. Especially if you don't care about Ranked and competitiveness.

I agree, I'm somewhere in the middle, I like to use the mouse as much as possible, and only have really important things set as hotkeys. I would much prefer a quick click on the interface to open the shop then finding/setting yet another hotkey.

Personal quests are available in Intro co-op vs AI, which is where new players are expected to go after the tutorial. Players who lack the information provided by those quests should probably go back and check them out.

Your first point was that there should be a way to open the shop without panning the camera to it and clicking on it. There already is such a way, so that point is moot. Your second point was that players shouldn't be expected to go through the list of hotkeys to find important ones like the shop. New players are explicitly given that hotkey along with a few others, so that point is moot as well. Do you have any additional points to make?

hmm, if that's what you got out of the post I'll try to explain it again so anyone could understand. The main point was to add a shop button to Ornn's  in game forge menu, improving that interface.

Yes I didn't know about the shop hotkey that was advertised in a quest, but a hotkey was not the point of the thread. The point was to improve Ornn's forge menu interface, which would also illustrate his forging ability to new players nicely.

The point is that such an "improvement" would simply be unnecessary clutter. The existing shop hotkey is perfectly fine (and you can even change it to something more convenient if you want - you did know you can reassign hotkeys, right?). "New players" have probably played intro co-op and thus would already know how to quickly shop. The game isn't designed around players who pride themselves on knowing less about the game than a new player would.
What I was gonna say lol.

So that's an interesting suggestion. On one hand, there is really no need for that button if you already know the game and its UI well, and it's more wasted space than anything else. On the other hand, if you DON'T know already, this button would really add to learnability and intuitiveness.

I'm really split.

I don't think it would waste space because the shop icon would take the spot of one suggested item (probably left one?), so instead of having 5 suggested items in his forge menu there would be 4 suggested items plus the shop button.
With all due respect, how can you say "you just would have 4 items instead of 5" and "no, it wouldn't waste space" both at the same time? x)  4 < 5
because it wouldn't take up more screen space, and you don't need 5 suggested items anyways...even three would probably be enough.
